Methylation-based enrichment facilitates low-cost, noninvasive genomic scale sequencing of populations from feces. Sci Rep 8, 1975 (2018). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41598-018-20427-9","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":141,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":165,"length":42}],"data":{}},{"key":"40o00","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"56dd9","text":"Portions of this protocol are modified from the NEBNext Microbiome DNA Enrichment Kit manual (New England Biolabs cat. #E2612S)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2cp8v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bhpfr","text":"Portions of Auxiliary Protocol A (Step 35) are modified from Pacific Biosciences protocol #001-252-177-03.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"157af","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f0rn6","text":"This full protocol and other supplementary information can be found here: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cssaf","text":"https://static-content.springer.com/esm/art%3A10.1038%2Fs41598-018-20427-9/MediaObjects/41598_2018_20427_MOESM1_ESM.pdf","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":119}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A3F7E69AAF3611EE8CED0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org/10.1038/s41598-018-20427-9"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"81948875AB3811EE819C0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://static-content.springer.com/esm/art%3A10.1038%2Fs41598-018-20427-9/MediaObjects/41598_2018_20427_MOESM1_ESM.pdf"}}}}

NaCl","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9uq2m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c85vu","text":"Auxiliary Protocol A: Bead Cleanup","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1igss","text":"Pre-washed magnetic SPRI beads, prepared following Rohland and Reich (2012)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8qe1r","text":"70% ethanol, freshly prepared","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8b430","text":"Magnetic stand","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fqogp","text":"Centrifuge","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fndmk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"csv1j","text":"Auxiliary Protocol B: qPCR Estimation of Enrichment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":51}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7p2a","text":"Extracted fDNA of known quantity","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2bu6u","text":"2X SYBR Green master mix (e.g., Qiagen cat #204143 or ThermoFisher Scientific cat. #A25780)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7nocn","text":"Taxon-specific primers","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eteku","text":"DNA standards ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b5t2h","text":"(For host quantifications, standards can be created by performing a dilution series (i.e., 10 ng/ μl, 1 ng/ μl, 0.1 ng/ μl, 0.01 ng/ μl) of high quality gDNA (such as blood or liver DNA from a suitable taxon.)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7t43b","text":"qPCR instrument","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1ud00","text":"Extract and prepare DNA samples","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dgd5n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2re30","text":"While any fecal DNA (fDNA) extraction method should in principle be compatible with the MBD enrichment, methods that maximize the recovery of host DNA are preferable. Bead-beating methods that increase total DNA yield from feces, for example, should be avoided because the mechanical disruption increases the yield of cell-wall-bound DNA (i.e., from bacteria or plants) while fragmenting host DNA. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"rr5a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"90rnr","text":"It is suggested to aim for a total yield of 1 µg of DNA for all samples in a maximum volume of 30 µl each, although there has been success with as little as 500 ng (the yield of host DNA is likely more important than the yield of total fDNA). If the volume is greater than 30 µl, the DNA can be concentrated via a bead cleanup (Auxiliary protocol A: Step 35 - 45). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eer2e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dh8pt","text":"Prior to enrichment, DNA should be quantified for the total yield (e.g., by fluorometer or spectrophotometer). Ideally, the host DNA should be quantified by qPCR (Auxiliary protocol B: Step 46 - 49). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"56her","text":"If preparing 40 µl of MBD beads, add   of MBD2-Fc protein to   of protein A magnetic beads in a 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube. For preparing other volumes (n µl) of MBD beads, add n/10 µl MBD2-Fc protein to n µl of protein A magnetic beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":154,"length":2},{"style":"italic","offset":178,"length":2},{"style":"italic","offset":205,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":37,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":61,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bmfc9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"273lp","text":"As a rule, do not prepare less than 40 µl of MBD beads due to diminished efficiency of both rotational mixing and magnetic separation at low volumes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"4","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"40","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7l813","text":"Mix the bead-protein mixture by rotating the tube in a rotating mixer for   at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":74,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bt55","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6paol","text":"Briefly spin the tube and place on the magnetic rack for   -    or until the beads have collected to the wall of the tube and the solution is clear. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":57,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":61,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aeojb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":120,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e8tkc","text":"Carefully remove the supernatant with a pipette without disturbing the beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ebk5b","text":"Add   of 1X bind/ wash buffer (kept on ice) to the tube to wash the beads. Pipette up and down a few times to mix. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1fka4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5d3v4","text":"Mix the beads by rotating the tube in a rotating mixer for   at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":59,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e2jof","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":180,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b37rr","text":"Briefly spin the tube and place on the magnetic rack for   -    or until the beads have collected to the wall of the tube and the solution is clear.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":57,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":62,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1d843","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":120,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2ummi","text":"Carefully remove the supernatant with a pipette without disturbing the beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a1kt0","text":"Repeat steps 10-13","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aqvkq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"24dmi","text":"If preparing between 160 µl and 320 µl of beads, repeat steps 10-13 twice for a total of three washes to ensure the removal of unbound MBD2-Fc protein. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2v79h","text":"Remove the tube from the rack and add n µl (determined in Step 6) of 1X bind/ wash buffer to resuspend the beads. Mix by pipetting the mixture up and down until the suspension is homogenous.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":38,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2shkc","text":"Since reaction volumes are well under 100 µl, multiple enrichment reactions can be processed together in a microplate, with pipetting steps conducted using a multichannel pipettor. Compatible rotating mixers and magnetic separators would also be required. Here, the capture procedure using a 1.5 ml tube is described.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ba3gq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"951qc","text":"The total volume of the capture reaction is an important consideration. A decreased DNA binding efficiency when the concentration of MBD beads or DNA in the capture reaction is low has been observed. It is therefore recommended maintaining a total reaction volume of approximately 40 µl, as a consistent success with this volume even when adding as little as 1 µl of MBD beads has been experienced. Decreasing the reaction volume may result in decreased efficacy of rotational mixing. It is a good idea to keep the volume of all reaction consitent as this facilitates processing of many samples and, if DNA amounts and bead volumes are kept consistent, serves as a control for the effects of bead or DNA concentration on enrichment efficiency. Subsequent procedures assume a reaction volume of 40 µl (not including MDB beads). If using other reaction volumes, pay particular attention to notes following each step in this section.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"84cep","text":"Aliquot   of 5X bind/ wash buffer to a 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"et8u3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ficm1","text":"For reaction volumes other than 40 µl, tube the volume of 5X bind/ wash buffer to maintain 1X concentration and adjust accordingly the volume of DNase-free water added in Step 18. The volume of MBD beads should be excluded from this calculation as prepared MBD beads are already at 1X concentration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9fot2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"37g0k","text":"It is recommend to equilibrate 5X bind/ wash buffer to room temperature prior to aliquoting for more accurate pipetting. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"banhl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"8","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6jb9","text":"Add up to   of DNA (prepared in Step 1) to the tube. Bring the total volume to   with DNase-free water. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":10,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":79,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"clulh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a9tih","text":"For reaction volumes other than 40 µl, adjust the volume of Dnase-free water added to reach the target volume. Be sure to maintain 1X bind/ wash concentration. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5dgvl","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"30","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"40","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"14p8f","text":"The NEBNext Microbiome Enrichment Kit Includes an elution protocol for captured DNA that includes digestion of DNA-bound MBD beads with proteinase K and elution with TE buffer. It has been found that elution with 2 M NaCl is just as effective, is less time consuming, and conserves proteinase K. Most importantly, it has been found that DNA sample eluted with 2 M NaCl and purified by bead cleanup can be further enriched in a repeat enrichment reaction. DNA samples eluted with proteinase K and TE buffer and purified by bead cleanup in contrast produced minuscule yields following a repeat enrichment reaction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"67r51","text":"Add   of 2 M NaCl (prepared in Step 5 and kept at room temperature) to the beads. Pipette the mixture up and down a few times to mix. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8iun6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"agpj8","text":"If large numbers of samples are being processed, considering lowering the elution volume such that the combined volume of DNA and SPRI beads (see Auxiliary protocol A: Step 35 - 45) does not exceed the capacity of microplate wells and thereby preclude the ability to parallelize based cleanups. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1rsd6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"33ev8","text":"Portions of this protocol are modified from Pacific Biosciences protocol #001-252-177-03.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bh2nf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3h9ad","text":"Add 1.5X - 1.8x volume of pre-washed magnetic beads to DNA in a 1.5 ml tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"70epu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bpj7","text":"If combined volume of beads and DNA does not exceed the capacity of the tube or well, large numbers of bead cleanups can be conducted in parallel on a microplate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dj8ar","text":"Mix the bead/ DNA solution thoroughly by pipetting up and down several times. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"frdh0","text":"Vortex the beads for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":21,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"14a7s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aime","text":"Briefly spin the tube and place on the magnetic rack for   or until the solution is clear. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":57,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ee2g7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5m7o8","text":"Carefully remove and discard the supernatant without disturbing the beads. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fk093","text":"Wash beads with freshly prepared 70% ethanol. Wait  , then pipette and discard the ethanol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":51,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e6lak","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7k72c","text":"Use a sufficient volume of 70% ethanol to completely cover the bead pellet (e.g., 100 µl for microplates and 400 µl for 1.5 ml tubes). Slowly dispense the 70% ethanol against the side of the tube opposite the beads. Do not disturb the bead pellet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"d52ja","text":"Repeat Step 40 above.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b2o13","text":"Remove residual 70% ethanol and air-dry the bead pellet for  . ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":60,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5rjoi","text":"Spin at full speed for   in order to collect residual 70% ethanol. Then place on the magnetic rack for   before pipetting the residual 70% ethanol and air-drying for  . ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":23,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":103,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":166,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"17tg4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":120,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":30,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"3":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ef8of","text":"Resuspend the beads in   -   of 1X TE buffer or another suitable DNA stabilization buffer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":23,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":27,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6o460","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"30","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"40","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fk8nf","text":"Vortex for  , then incubate for  . Spin the sample at full speed to pellet beads. Return to the magnet and collect the supernatant in a new 1.5 ml microcenrifuge tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":11,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":32,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1t03n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":120,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cq3ju","text":"Following bead cleanup, quantify with a fluorometer or spectrometer. Validate enrichment by qPCR (Auxiliary protocol B: Step 46 - 49). Enriched DNA can be sequentially enriched by repeating the enrichment protocol adding   of the enriched product to the FecalSeq enrichment protocol: Step 18. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":221,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"30","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

steps.section: Auxiliary Protocol B: qPCR Estimation of Enrichment
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"aml4r","text":"Run samples and standards at least in duplicate. It is recommended to run a positive and negative control with each set of quantifications.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Auxiliary Protocol B: qPCR Estimation of Enrichment
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4n1eq","text":"Use primers specific to the analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3df7l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8usjc","text":"a. The proportion of host DNA can be quantified by comparing qPCR results using host-specific primers to the absolute quantification estimated by some independent means (e.g., fluorometer or spectrophotometer). For the baboon DNA quantifications used here, a universal mammal primers for the MYCBP (c-myc) gene (Morin et al. 2001) was used. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":292,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ffivn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"70bb7","text":"b. Enrichment of DNA captured with MBD beads can be quantified as above using host-specific primers with enriched methylated host DNA. Alternatively, enrichment can be estimated by observing the n-fold decrease in quantified levels from unenriched to enriched samples using the universal 16S rRNA primer (Corless et al. 2000). 1 µl of unenriched DNA can be diluted to the concentration of the enriched sample prior to qPCR to standardize concentrations. Because MBD enrichment can in principle be biased towards densely methylated areas of the host genome, the latter method for estimating enrichment success is preferred. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":195,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bpp9c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ghrv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f0i77","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":131,"id":433899,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"Screenshot 2024-01-04 at 2.20.10 PM.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/phzpb6qjp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/phzmb6qjp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/phznb6qjp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/phzkb6qjp.webp","width":550}}}}

steps.section: Auxiliary Protocol B: qPCR Estimation of Enrichment
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a9h7s","text":"Set up qPCR reactions in a   total volume containing 1X of SYBR Green master mix,   of each primer, and   of DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":27,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":82,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":104,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7iu07","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.5","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":3050}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5bega","text":"Calculate the required volume of MBD2-Fc-bound magnetic beads (hereafter referred to as \"MBD beads\") for each enrichment reaction, as well as the total volume for a set of reactions as follows. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2llmc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqvlc","text":"As an approximate rule, prepare   of MBD beads for every   of target host DNA in each enrichment reaction. If samples contain less than 6.25 ng of host DNA or if the amount of host DNA is not quantified, prepare 1 µl of MBD beads. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":32,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":57,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"s9hi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5acmu","text":"It is recommend to prepare batches of MBD beads (see Step 5) with a minimum volume of  , as lower volumes preclude adequate mixing. If a smaller volume is needed, leftover unused MBD beads can be stored at   for up to a week. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":86,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":206,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8uvqb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"6.25","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":8}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"40","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"3":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9j8kk","text":"Resuspend protein A magnetic beads by gently pipetting the mixture up and down until the suspension is homogenous, or by slowly rotating the mixture at   for  . ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":152,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":158,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dgc4p","text":"Do not vortex.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fsdb8","text":"Prepare 1X bind/ wash buffer by diluting 1 part 5X bind/ wash buffer with 4 parts DNase-free water. As a general rule, the volume of 2X bind/ wash buffer needed can be calculated as: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2la3h","text":"2.5 ml +1.2 ml x [number of enrichment reactions]","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5o5p4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9hh81","text":"Then amount of 1X bind/ wash buffer depends on the total volume of MBD beads and the total number of enrichment reactions. MBD beads can be prepared with a maximum volume of 160 µl in a single reaction. As very small volumes (1 - 8 µl) of beads are needed for enrichment method, a single bead preparation reaction is nearly always sufficient. If more beads are needed increase the number of bead preparation reactions and adjust the volume of 1X bind/ wash buffer accordingly. Alternatively, for volumes up to 320 µl, prepare an additional 1 ml of 1X bind/ wash buffer per bead preparation reaction and add an extra wash step (see Step 14). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7gmav","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ep6p","text":"2.5 ml of 1X bind/ wash buffer are required for a single bead preparation reaction up to 160 µl. Prepare an additional 1.2 ml of 1X bind/ wash buffer per enrichment reaction. This number takes into account the volume needed to prepare 2 M NaCl elution buffer in the following step","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"43up6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f2una","text":"Keep 1X bind/ wash buffer on ice throughout the MBD bead preparation. For the wash steps following the capture reaction, 1X bind/ wash buffer can be at room temperature. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c754d","text":"Prepare 2 M NaCl elution buffer by diluting 5 M NaCl with 1X bind/ wash buffer.   of 2 M NaCl elution buffer are needed per enrichment reaction. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":80,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ds79d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"af2d4","text":"1X bind/ wash buffer has a NaCl concentration of 150 mM. 1 ML OF 2 M NaCl elution buffer can be prepared by adding   of 5 M NaCl with   of 1X bind/ wash buffer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":115,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":134,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3q8fv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"370","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"630","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"erre8","text":"Add MBD beads to the tube using the volume determined in Step 2. Pipette the mixture up and down or swirl a few times to mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6l66r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7hpgg","text":"As an approximate rule and as stated above, add   of MBD beads for every   of target host DNA in each enrichment reaction. If samples contain less than 6.25 ng of host DNA or if the amount of host DNA is not quantified, add 1 µl of MBD beads. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":48,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":73,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a7c98","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"6.25","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":8}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"akc19","text":"Incubate the reaction for   at room temperature with rotation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":26,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1o5o7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6mk8o","text":"Following incubation at room temperature, briefly spin the tube and place on the magnetic rack for   until the beads have collected to the wall and the solution is clear. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":99,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f6cvi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ejgvh","text":"Carefully remove the supernatant with a pipette without disturbing the beads. The supernatant is enriched for microbial DNA and may be saved and purified by bead cleanup (Auxiliary protocol A: Step 35 - 45). Otherwise, discard the supernatant. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"h39c","text":"Add   of 1 bind/ wash buffer (kept at room temperature) to wash the beads. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9ct4e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dir18","text":"If processing in a microplate, decrease the volume of wash buffer to 100 µl. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5aruh","text":"Carefully remove and discard the wash buffer with a pipette without discarding the beads. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5sp3d","text":"Optional. Add   of 1X bind/ wash buffer (kept at room temperature) to the beads. Pipette the mixture up and down a few times to mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":14,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6disk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bp93v","text":"It has been found that an individual wash with   of 1X bind/ wash buffer followed by rotation (Steps 25 - 28) substantially improved enrichment. To skip this wash, proceed to step 29. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":47,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6qq22","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4v704","text":"Mix the beads by rotating the tube in a rotating mixer for   at room temperature. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":59,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c9tk3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":180,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6o0oq","text":"Briefly spin the tube and place on the magnetic rack for   -   until the beads have collected to the wall of the tube and the solution is clear. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":57,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":61,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6tgdu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":120,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eoeq8","text":"Carefully remove and discard the supernatant with a pipette without disturbing the beads. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cqsmt","text":"Mix the beads by rotating the tube in a rotating mixer for   at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":59,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2touo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":180,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7s37l","text":"Breify spin the tube and place on the magnetic rack for   -  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":56,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":60,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ff0oc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":120,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ecboj","text":"Carefully remove the supernatant to a fresh microcentrifuge and discard beads. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3lf39","text":"Proceed to bead cleanup to purify sample (Auxiliary protocol A: Step 35 - 45). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
